extendedIngredients.name: cayenne pepper
extendedIngredients.originalString: Optional spices: cayenne pepper, paprika, thyme

extendedIngredients.name: dry mustard
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 heaping teaspoons dry mustard (more if desired)

extendedIngredients.name: macaroni n cheese
extendedIngredients.originalString: Cooked sliders and/or macaroni and cheese, for serving

extendedIngredients.name: sharp cheddar
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 pound sharp Cheddar, grated (not pre-grated cheese), plus more for baking

recipes.title: Macaroni and Cheese

winePairing.pairingText: Macaroni and Cheese works really well with Lambrusco, Chenin Blanc, and Riesling. With rich, cheesy mac & cheese you'll want to cleanse the palate with something crisp and acidic. We recommend Chenin Blanc, Riesling, or dry Lambrusco if you're in the mood for a red. You could try PRONTO Lambrusco Secco. Reviewers quite like it with a 5 out of 5 star rating and a price of about 20 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: PRONTO Lambrusco Secco
productMatches.description: Crimson purple color. Aromas are rich with purple iris, clove and licorice. Medium-bodied, dry (secco), excellent concentration, rich finish, abundant fruit, dry. This wine offers complexity and richness on the palate.

recipes.instructions: Watch how to make this recipe.                    Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.                          Cook the macaroni until still slightly firm. Drain and set aside.                          In a small bowl, beat the egg. In a large pot, melt the butter and sprinkle in the flour. Whisk together over medium-low heat. Cook for a couple of minutes, whisking constantly. Don't let it burn. Pour in the milk, add the mustard and whisk until smooth. Cook until very thick, about 5 minutes. Reduce the heat to low.                          Take 1/4 cup of the sauce and slowly pour it into the beaten egg, whisking constantly to avoid cooking the eggs. Whisk together until smooth. Pour the egg into the sauce, whisking constantly. Stir until smooth. Add in the cheese and stir to melt. Add 1/2 teaspoon salt, 1/2 teaspoon seasoned salt and the pepper. Add any additional spices if desired. Taste the sauce and add more salt and seasoned salt as needed! DO NOT UNDERSALT.                          Pour in the drained, cooked macaroni and stir to combine. Serve immediately (while it's still very creamy) or pour into a buttered baking dish, top with extra cheese and bake until bubbly and golden on top, 20 to 25 minutes.                          Fry the bacon in a skillet over medium-high heat until slightly crisp, about 8 minutes. Remove from the pan and cut into bite-size pieces.                          In a separate pan, cook the onions in the butter over a low heat until caramelized, 20 to 30 minutes, stirring occasionally.                          Use a fork to crumble the gorgonzola.                          Put the bacon, caramelized onions and crumbled gorgonzola into separate bowls. Serve as delicious toppings for both sliders and macaroni cheese.

steps.step: Watch how to make this recipe.
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.
Cook the macaroni until still slightly firm.
Drain and set aside.
In a small bowl, beat the egg. In a large pot, melt the butter and sprinkle in the flour.
Whisk together over medium-low heat. Cook for a couple of minutes, whisking constantly. Don't let it burn.
Pour in the milk, add the mustard and whisk until smooth. Cook until very thick, about 5 minutes. Reduce the heat to low.
Take 1/4 cup of the sauce and slowly pour it into the beaten egg, whisking constantly to avoid cooking the eggs.
Whisk together until smooth.
Pour the egg into the sauce, whisking constantly. Stir until smooth.
Add in the cheese and stir to melt.
Add 1/2 teaspoon salt, 1/2 teaspoon seasoned salt and the pepper.
Add any additional spices if desired. Taste the sauce and add more salt and seasoned salt as needed! DO NOT UNDERSALT.
Pour in the drained, cooked macaroni and stir to combine.
Serve immediately (while it's still very creamy) or pour into a buttered baking dish, top with extra cheese and bake until bubbly and golden on top, 20 to 25 minutes.
Fry the bacon in a skillet over medium-high heat until slightly crisp, about 8 minutes.
Remove from the pan and cut into bite-size pieces.
In a separate pan, cook the onions in the butter over a low heat until caramelized, 20 to 30 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Use a fork to crumble the gorgonzola.
Put the bacon, caramelized onions and crumbled gorgonzola into separate bowls.
Serve as delicious toppings for both sliders and macaroni cheese.
